description: Borrowed from German Aurochs, an early variant of Auerochse, from Middle High German ūrochse (“aurochs”), from Old High German ūrohso (“aurochs”), a compound consisting of ūro (“aurochs”) (from Proto-Germanic *ūraz, *ūrô (“aurochs”)) + ohso (“ox”). Akin to Old English ūr (“aurochs”), Old Norse úrr (“aurochs”), Middle Low German ūrosse (“aurochs”), Old English oxa (“ox”). More at ox.

nouns.description: aurochs (plural aurochs or aurochses or aurochsen)

entries.meaning: An extinct European mammal, Bos primigenius, the ancestor of domestic cattle.
(zoology) The European bison (Bison bonasus, or Europæus).
